check.name: MagicNumberCheck
check.description:
Checks that there are no "magic numbers" where a magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

Constant definition is any variable/field that has 'final' modifier. It is fine to have one constant defining multiple numeric literals within one expression:

property.name: ignoreHashCodeMethod
property.description: Ignore magic numbers in hashCode methods.

property.name: ignoreAnnotation
property.description: Ignore magic numbers in annotation declarations.

property.name: ignoreFieldDeclaration
property.description: Ignore magic numbers in field declarations.

property.name: ignoreAnnotationElementDefaults
property.description: Ignore magic numbers in annotation elements defaults.

property.name: constantWaiverParentToken
property.description: Specify tokens that are allowed in the AST path from the number literal to the enclosing constant definition.
